comments.body: I wonder why is this being deferred, should not it be called directly instead?
It's deferring execution of the return value rather than `SetFeatureGateDuringTest()` itself. The first call sets the feature to false and the second call restores its previous value.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +668,672 @@// This validates that the feature gate is working, but kubectl also uses the 404 to guess that the feature is disabled on the server.
func TestPodEphemeralContainersDisabled(t *testing.T) {
	defer featuregatetesting.SetFeatureGateDuringTest(t, utilfeature.DefaultFeatureGate, features.EphemeralContainers, false)()

	_, s, closeFn := framework.RunAMaster(nil)

comments.body:
Thanks for writing these tests. Who is a good owner for pod tests?

Can you create a `test/integration/pods/OWNERS` file with those people? See other directories like https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/477f17475dd7edb2d395688dc83bd25bccef9165/test/e2e/node/OWNERS etc for examples

It's a good question. Since these mainly test API semantics I guess the question is: who owns the core API? sig-node seems a likely candidate for pods at least. I'll talk it over with @yujuhong and come up with a suggestion (in the form of a PR).

/cc @smarterclayton @dchen1107 @derekwaynecarr

The features tested in this directory so far are all (co-)sponsored by sig-node, even though the testing is limited to the api semantics/machinery.

Maybe sig-node can own this. @dchen1107 @derekwaynecarr WDYT?
